name: Eggless Banana Bread
description: This eggless dish uses common household ingredients to make the best banana bread to ever exist! And, you'll never guess that it's eggless!
instructions: Put the bananas and sugar in a mixing bowl and mash/puree them.
Add the oil, vanilla, cinnamon powder, and nutmeg powder and mix thoroughly.
In another bowl, sieve the whole weat flower, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Add to the banana puree.
Fold the dry and wet ingredients in a cut-and-fold method. Do not mix.
If the batter looks very thick or dry, mix about 1/3 or 1/4 cup of water and fold the batter again.
Pour the mixture into the bread pan.
Bake at 180 degrees Celsius or 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 30-40 minutes. A toothpick or bamboo skewer inserted into the bread should come out clean - this means the bread is fully cooked.
Let cool, slice, serve, and enjoy!

name: Homemade Hot Cocoa
description: This homemade hot cocoa will be the perfect drink to your rainy December afteroon. You'll never find yourself heading to the coffee shop for cocoa again!
ingredients: 4 cups of milk, preferably 2% or whole milk
1/2 cup bittersweet or semisweet chocolate chips
instructions: Add the milk, cocoa powder, and sugar in a small pan.
Heat over medium/medium-low heat, frequently whisking the mixture until it is warm but not too hot.
Add the chocolate chips and whisk cintinuously until the chocolate chips melt into the milk completely

name: Instant Coffee
description: This instant coffee takes less than 5 minutes to make, and tastes just as refreshing as any other coffee! And, it's the perfect compliment to your banana bread!
ingredients: 1.5 cups of milk, preferably 2% or whole milk
instructions: Heat up the milk for about 45 seconds in a microwave.
Add the coffee mix and the sugar and stir completely.
Microwave the milk, powder, and sugar for another 30 seconds and stir when finished.
